text: what has happened here basically is the
church has you know fallen over a cliff
and it's moral authorities completely
destroyed respect for the church trusts
in the church people don't look for
guidance to the church anymore
the number of people who identify as
Catholics has dropped by about 20% we
used to have hundreds of men going into
the seminaries every year and I think
this year there was something like six
something like that but the main thing
is that their reputation and their
credibility and and their position as
moral leaders I mean people can't look
to these men from our leadership when
you look at the lack of morality by so
many in leadership in the church in the
way they have dealt with abusers of
children if the Pope comes here if he
meets survivors who are going to be
allowed to put to him very bluntly what
they feel that church should be doing
and ask him very clearly why he's not
doing it if he comes out and makes a
statement of what he is going to do not
hopes to do is thinking of doing or is
him working on as his letter said if he
comes out and says I'm going to do this
and I'm going this is how I'm going to
do it just stop all this I think that
will give people a reason to hold on a
little longer I think if it all just
goes through the motions and we get the
sort of apologies we've had before you
know sorry this happened sorry you're
hurt that sort of thing and I think the
path is just going to go further and
further to the church losing all all
believability all credibility
